creator: haddock@tripi.com
text:
I am running two tomcat servers, one on 8109 and another on 8209. If I have a
session which is talking to 8109, then shut down 8109, it properly fails over to
8209. However, POST requests to 8209 fail with "Short Read". Attached is a
tcpdump which shows the entire process, the POST request being sent fine to
Apache, but then the request to Tomcat has no data for the post request.

creator: haddock@tripi.com
text:
Created attachment 3084
HEX/ASCII dump of entire browser to Apache to Tomcat communication

creator: haddock@tripi.com
text:
Also, I am running Red Hat 7.3 with Tomcat 4.0.4le, Apache 1.3.23, and
mod_jk-1.3-1.0-1.4.0.2 all installed from RPM.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
I fixed this bug in mod_jk2. Not sure how difficult it is to backport to
jk1, the error handling and recovery was reorganized ( to get around other bugs).
I'll mark this as fixed - please reopen it if you still have problems ( with jk2)
or if you need it backported.
